results.title: Self-help
results.brief_description: Villagers in Malaya, living in widely separated huts open to attack by terrorists, clear a new site and move their village to an area more easily protected by police and their newly formed Home Guard unit.

results.title: Selena
results.brief_description: In this biographical drama, Selena Quintanilla is born into a musical Mexican-American family in Texas. Her father, Abraham, realizes that his young daughter is talented and begins performing with her at small venues. She finds success and falls for her guitarist, Chris Perez, who draws the ire of her father. Seeking mainstream stardom, Selena begins recording an English-language album which, tragically, she would never complete.

constellations_other.name: Aquaman VFX
constellations_other.description: As well as becoming a global box-office sensation, Aquaman (2018) featured groundbreaking visual effects from Australian companies such as Method Studios.

results.title: Selective breeding
results.creator_credit: Ron Lea and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description:
Investigates the deliberate breeding of particular characteristics into different animals. Discusses the idea that many fashionable characteristics can lead to animals which are not functional. Also looks at the breeding of horses and chickens with breeders outlining some of the methods used to produce or maintain particular characterisitics.
Suitable for upper secondary levels.

results.title: Selections from the Christmas Oratorio by J.S. Bach
results.creator_credit: David Bairstow, Peter Jones and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The Montreal Bach Choir under the direction of George Little has sung in many countries. This film presents the choir in one of its most distinguished performances with guest soloists Elizabeth Benson Guy, soprano; Maureen Forrester, contralto; Glenn Schnittke, tenor; Jan Simons, bass; James Ranti, trumpet; and Calvin Sieb, concertmaster.

results.title: Selections from a child's garden of verses
results.creator_credit: Robert Louis Stevenson, Wil Berg and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description: Wildberg, who made this film, reads excerpts from Robert Louis Stevenson’s collection including “I have a little shadow” and “The Swing”, while a boy experiences or watches others experience the emotions and sensations of the poems

results.title: Selection of Your Horse
results.brief_description: In this program Captain Mark Phillips enables you, the prospective purchaser to determine your requirements in a saddle horse and shows you how to look for a suitable animal. He explains in clear terms the individual attributes of a horse that are important to you to consider and pays particular attention to the following areas: (1) Conformation, (2) Soundness, (3) Temperament, (4) Performance under saddle, (5) Dangers and pitfalls and how to avoid them, (6) Veterinary report and how to evaluate it.

results.title: Selection of titles from the Inala Straford Home Movie Archive Collection
results.brief_description: Diverse productions made by brothers Frank and John Straford in their Brighton Backyard between 1951 and 1956. Without formal training and using the most basic of equipment and self invented production techniques, the brothers produced an irresistible array of short animations, scripted dramas and home movies that have a freshness and charm 50 years later.

results.title: Selection of dimensions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Engineering Drawing”

Introduces the principles which govern the choice of dimensions. These principles are shown to be based on two factors: (1) the functional characteristics of the object, which includes consideration of the accuracy demanded and the relation of the portion to other elements of the unit or machine; and (2) the manufacturing methods used in making the object.

results.title: Selection interview. No. 3
results.creator_credit: Ian Woolf, Tony Matthews and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Interaction”.
Part 4 of a series of films for managers. Based on a management selection interview, mounted as a special exercise with the Manchester Business School. Shows the selection panel’s final assessment of the candidate. Includes a review of the exercise. Introduced by Brian Redhead.
